definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
poor monk (humble term used by monk of himself)
benefactor (term used by a monk to address a layperson)/donor (semiconductor)
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
brother (polite appellation for a friend one's age)
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
